p: Pinene (C 10H 16) is a bicyclic, double-bond terpenoid hydrocarbon, representing the family of monoterpenes. The α-pinene and β-pinene are two structural isomers found in nature, e.g., in pine (coniferous trees) essential oils (EO). Both isomers have two enantiomers (+) and (–) ( Figure 18) and exhibit diverse pharmacological activities, e.g., antimicrobial, antiviral, antispasmodic, antifungal, antiviral, anticancer, antimalarial, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory effects [ 73, 74, 75, 76].
